title: Handle subdatasets in subdirectories correctly in the web browser listing frontend
body:
Attempt to fix up #1674 ... coming out a bit more than just a bugfix, since to get better clue on what is going on in that code had to do some RFing

But in that light I think there are still missing points, since blind attempt to regenerate meta-data for
http://datasets.datalad.org/?dir=/workshops/nih-2017/ds000114 didn't fully worked out

But it worked correctly while having old meta-data inplace ;)  so I guess it is just missing some additional bit.

- [x] fix it up: 
     - atm seems to traverse subdatasets directories with only -a flag
     - for some reason assigns the same tags from superdataset into subdatasets: http://datasets.datalad.org/?dir=/workshops/nih-2017/ds000114/derivatives  (may be it is just a web ui bug? didn't check yet metadata itself) -- I guess this one was fixed since I am not observing it
- [x] reenable disabled checks
- [x] verify correct operation on ds000114 in typical invocation in the hook but also may be in -r mode (which so

The code there is messy and needs a huge RF and might even at some point be melded with new metadata handling since lots in common, but not now.

I have rerendered web metadata for http://datasets.datalad.org/?dir=/labs/haxby/attention and http://datasets.datalad.org/?dir=/workshops/nih-2017 so they look proper.  For that updated datalad on the webserver from 0.7.0-95-g551efff2 to this PR 0.9.1-291-ge61f0841
